column4: Hello room :) I am running an update on a new Ubtunu 10.10 install and it keeps hanging at configuring linux-image-2.6.35-22-generic. In the update box it says Generating grub.cfg..............it has been that way for 30 minutes. Suggestions please?
It can take a whole for that portion to finish,
is the computer still responsive to key presses (like cpas lock turning on and off)
something must have gone wrong during the update... I'm not sure what to do at that point
killing the update could have unfortunate consequences
This isn't a WUBI install is it?
you can try to kill it and restart it... worst case when it boots you will have to boot into the previous kernel
are you running the update in terminal or graphical?
that one I'm not sure... you could check out your process manager to see if you can spot it ther
thanks,  i usually run all my updates in the Command line
It is possible, the update manager runs the dpkg configuartion which checks to see fi the settings file has been modified from it's original installed version
I doubt nvidia drivers would cause a problem
How do I boot to CLI?
boot to it.......going to update my system before editing grub with nomodeset
there really isn't a good way to do that... unlike other distros, you may not have networking when booting to CLI
you can try booting to recovery mode
